consent.title: Informed Consent Form
consent.helper: If any term is not clear, try reading it in another language.
paragraphs: You are invited to participate in the research project “Quality Promotion Practices in Game Development: An Observational Study”, conducted by Esdras Caleb Oliveira Silva (principal investigator) and Lyrene Fernandes da Silva (supervisor).
This research is intended exclusively for individuals aged 18 or older who work in digital game development.
We aim to identify ways to integrate automated testing practices into game development, especially in the context of independent teams.
If you decide to participate, you will answer 28 questions about your profile as a game developer, the software engineering practices you use, and the types of testing employed in game validation.

The estimated time to answer all questions is 15 minutes. You may feel slight discomfort due to the time required to answer all the questions, but the form automatically saves your answers in your browser, allowing you to continue later.

Risks, Confidentiality, and Benefits:
Your participation involves minimal risks. The main risk is fatigue from answering the questionnaire, which is mitigated by the option to save your answers and continue later. As an online survey, there are risks associated with the virtual environment, such as a breach of confidentiality. To protect your information, we, the researchers, have adopted the following measures:
  • Data Collection: Your answers will be anonymous. We will collect your browser and form language for analysis. Providing your email is optional and will only be used if you wish to participate in an interview for the research.
  • Security: We take responsibility for storing all data in a secure digital environment with restricted access to ensure its confidentiality.
Benefits: Directly, the questions can help you reflect on your work practices. Indirectly, your contribution will generate knowledge for the game development community and will aid in the creation of a future automated testing framework.

If you have any questions, please contact:
Esdras Caleb Oliveira Silva – SEDIS/UFRN
Av. Sen. Salgado Filho, 3000, Lagoa Nova, Natal/RN, CEP 59078-970
Email: acheicaleb@gmail.com
Phone: +55 (84) 99688-8803
You can refuse to participate or withdraw at any time without penalty or prejudice.
The data provided, with the exception of the optional email, will be anonymous and confidential, used exclusively for academic purposes, and stored for 5 years.

Ethical questions can be clarified with the UFRN Research Ethics Committee (CEP Central/UFRN):
WhatsApp: (84) 99193-6266
Email: cepufrn@propesq.ufrn.br
Address: UFRN – Av. Sen. Salgado Filho, 3000, Lagoa Nova, Natal/RN, CEP 59078-900

You can also contact the National Research Ethics Commission (Conep):
Phone: (61) 3315-5877
Email: conep@saude.gov.br

common.required_one_option: Please select at least one option.

survey.year_of_birth: In what year were you born?
survey.country_work: In which country do you primarily work/operate in game development?
survey.formacao: What is your highest level of education?
survey.area_formacao: In which area is your highest level of education?

area_formacao_o.computacao: Computer Science / Software Engineering / Information Systems

survey.anos_experiencia: For how many years have you been working in the digital game development industry?
survey.qtd_projetos: How many game projects (released or not) have you worked on?
survey.situacao: What is your primary role in digital game development today? (Select the option that best describes your current situation.)

situacao_o.atuacao_industria_integral: I work full-time at a company in the digital games industry
situacao_o.atuacao_industria_parcial: I work part-time at a company in the digital games industry
situacao_o.atuacao_freelancer: I develop games as a freelancer/self-employed on a regular basis
situacao_o.atuacao_indie_horas_vagas: I develop games independently in my spare time (unpaid or with occasional payment)
situacao_o.atuacao_eventual: I develop games occasionally, on specific or collaborative projects
situacao_o.atuacao_nao_envolvido: I am not currently involved with digital game development, but I intend to return to this area.

survey.situacao_equipe: What type of team do you usually work with on game development projects? Consider the majority of the projects you participate in.

situacao_equipe_o.pequena: In a small team (2 to 5 people)
situacao_equipe_o.media: In a medium team (6 to 15 people)
situacao_equipe_o.grande: In a large team (more than 15 people)
situacao_equipe_o.varia: It varies greatly from project to project
situacao_equipe_o.nao_participa: I work independently and have no direct contact with the project team

survey.duracao_projetos: On average, what is the duration of the projects you participate in?
survey.funcoes: What roles/functions do you usually perform?
survey.tipos_jogos: What types of games do you develop most often?
survey.plataformas_desenvolvimento: For which platforms do you usually develop games?
survey.ferramentas_desenvolvimento: Which engines do you usually use in the projects you work on or have worked on?

ferramentas_desenvolvimento_options.propria_corporativa: Proprietary engine from the company I work/worked for
ferramentas_desenvolvimento_options.nada: I don't use game engines (programming with basic libs like SDL)

survey.uso_praticas_modelagem_projeto: Project modeling (e.g., flowcharts, state diagrams, etc.)

uso_praticas.label: For each of the practices below, select the alternative that best represents your experience in game development.

opcoes.nao_conhece: I don't use it because I'm not familiar with it
opcoes.nao_util: I don't see its utility for my projects
opcoes.ja_tentou: I've tried using it, but found it complicated or overkill
opcoes.prefere_outros: I prefer to focus on other areas of development

survey.dificuldades_manutencao: In your experience, what makes it most difficult to evolve and maintain projects over time? (Choose up to 3 options)

dificuldades_manutencao_o.codigo_dificil: The code becomes difficult to understand over time
dificuldades_manutencao_o.mudancas_quebram: Making changes causes unexpected errors in other parts of the game
dificuldades_manutencao_o.comunicacao_dificil: Difficulty in communication among team members
dificuldades_manutencao_o.prazo_curto: Lack of time or tight deadlines
dificuldades_manutencao_o.mudancas_escopo: Changes in scope or features mid-project
dificuldades_manutencao_o.sem_boas_praticas: Absence of good software engineering practices
dificuldades_manutencao_o.sem_dificuldades: I do not face significant difficulties in this aspect

survey.testes_jogo: What forms of testing do you usually use to verify that the game is working correctly?

testes_jogo_options.exploratorio: Exploratory testing — I play freely and observe for flaws or strange behaviors
testes_jogo_options.roteiro: Scripted testing — I follow a list of steps or a checklist to verify specific functionalities
testes_jogo_options.automatizado: Automated testing — I use tools or scripts to test parts of the game without manual intervention

survey.dificuldades_testes: If you have tried using automated tests, what were the main difficulties? (Select the main ones)

dificuldades_testes_options.entendimento_frameworks: Difficulty understanding how testing tools work.
dificuldades_testes_options.implementacao_dificil: Complexity in integrating tests into the project's workflow.
dificuldades_testes_options.preferencia_humanos: The feeling that manual tests are more practical or efficient.
dificuldades_testes_options.nao_encontram_erros_reais: Perception that automated tests do not find the "important bugs".
dificuldades_testes_options.nunca_usei: I have never tried using automated tests.

survey.ferramentas_teste: What tools have you used to create automated tests in your game projects? (Leave blank if you have never used any)

ferramentas_teste_options.godot_tests: A Godot Test Framework Plugin (e.g., GUT or gdUnit)

survey.conteudo_testado: Which types of failures do your tests usually cover? (Select up to 3)

conteudo_testado_options.ambiental: Ambiental — Stuck, problemas de alcançabilidade (reachability) e posicionamento incorreto
conteudo_testado_options.logica: Lógica — implementação incorreta, falhas de balanceamento, deadlocks e softlocks
conteudo_testado_options.simulacao: Simulação — erros de colisão, colisão ausente ou caixa/mesh incorreta
conteudo_testado_options.multimidia: Multimídia — quedas de FPS, problemas de som, animação, renderização, HUD ou voz
conteudo_testado_options.producao: Produção — crashes, freezes em plataformas específicas, regressões e problemas de recursos (Memória/CPU/Conexão)

survey.objetivo_teste: What is the main objective of the tests you perform in the game? (Select up to 3)

objetivo_teste_options.corretude_funcional: Corretude Funcional — garantir que o jogo funciona como deveria
objetivo_teste_options.experiencia_design: Experiência e Design — verificar jogabilidade, equilíbrio e fluxo da experiência
objetivo_teste_options.visual_multimidia: Visual e Multimídia — validar gráficos, UI, animações e áudio
objetivo_teste_options.desempenho_estabilidade: Desempenho e Estabilidade — checar FPS, uso de recursos e estabilidade da execução
objetivo_teste_options.corretude_fisica: Corretude Física — confirmar que colisões e comportamentos físicos estão corretos

survey.etapa_testes: At what stage of development are they created? (Leave blank if you do not use automated tests)

etapa_testes_options.antes_funcionalidade: Before implementing the functionality — I follow a Test-Driven Development approach
etapa_testes_options.durante_funcionalidade: During or right after implementing the functionality — I write the tests along with the code
etapa_testes_options.pos_prototipo: After creating a functional prototype — I test when I already have something playable or testable
etapa_testes_options.final: Only at the end of the project, during the review phase
etapa_testes_options.quando_possivel: When there is time or opportunity — without a defined stage in the process

survey.requisito_testes: In which situations are automated tests used as a mandatory requirement in your projects?

requisito_testes_options.atualizacao: To accept updates from collaborators (e.g., pull requests)
requisito_testes_options.proxima_fase: To allow the project to advance to the next phase (alpha, beta)
requisito_testes_options.nova_funcionalidade: To start the development of a new functionality
requisito_testes_options.nunca: They are not a mandatory requirement in the projects

survey.avaliacao_artefatos: How do you usually evaluate the quality of the creative artifacts you produce (images, sounds, icons, videos, layouts, etc.)?

avaliacao_artefatos_o.criterios_definidos: I use previously defined criteria (e.g., style, clarity, suitability for the audience)
avaliacao_artefatos_o.avaliacao_subjetiva: I make a more subjective assessment, based on my own perception
avaliacao_artefatos_o.testes_formais: I conduct formal tests with users or specific tools
avaliacao_artefatos_o.avaliacao_por_outros: The evaluation is mainly done by other people on the team
avaliacao_artefatos_o.sem_avaliacao_estruturada: We do not usually perform a structured evaluation

survey.design_validacao: How do you usually test or validate your design before full implementation?

design_validacao_options.prototipo_simplificado: Through simplified playable prototypes (digital or analog)
design_validacao_options.prototipo_real: With physical or real-world simulations (e.g., with people, objects, enactments)
design_validacao_options.excel: Using spreadsheets to simulate systems or balancing
design_validacao_options.mental: I mentally simulate the scenarios and interactions

survey.areas_uso_ia: In what ways have you been using generative AIs (ChatGPT, Copilot, Midjourney, etc.) in game development?

areas_uso_ia_o.ideias_criativas: To generate creative ideas (e.g., characters, mechanics, narratives, dialogues)
areas_uso_ia_o.conteudo_visual_sonoro: To create visual or sound content (e.g., concept art, voices, soundtracks, effects)
areas_uso_ia_o.implementacao: To assist in implementation (e.g., writing or reviewing code, suggesting technical solutions)
areas_uso_ia_o.planejamento: To plan or structure the game (e.g., documentation, system architecture, balancing)
areas_uso_ia_o.testes: To create or suggest automated tests (e.g., generating test cases, validation scripts)
areas_uso_ia_o.validacao: To review or validate game functionalities (e.g., finding errors, checking logic)
areas_uso_ia_o.ainda_nao_usei: I haven't used AI yet, but I'm curious or interested
areas_uso_ia_o.nao_usarei: I do not use AI in my game projects

survey.percepcao_uso_ia: What are your main concerns about the use of generative AIs in the field? (Select up to 2 options)

percepcao_uso_ia_options.dados_copyright: Use of copyrighted data without consent (to train the AI)
percepcao_uso_ia_options.privacidade: Privacy concerns: my inputs may be reused without my control
percepcao_uso_ia_options.substituicao: Fear that professionals in the field will be replaced by AI
percepcao_uso_ia_options.transparencia: Lack of transparency about how the AI works or makes decisions
percepcao_uso_ia_options.originalidade: Difficulty in validating the originality or reliability of what is generated
percepcao_uso_ia_options.etica: Ethics in the use of AI (e.g., authorship, credits, plagiarism)
percepcao_uso_ia_options.sem_preocupacoes: I do not have significant concerns at the moment

survey.any_comment: Would you like to leave any final comments about testing in the projects you participate in?
survey.contato_entrevista: We would like to know more about the testing carried out in game development. Would you like to be contacted for an interview?
survey.email_required: Please provide us with a means of contact.
